intro: Piptocarpha steyermarkii, commonly known as the desert aster, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. It is a perennial herb characterized by its gray-green foliage and clusters of small, pink to purple flowers. The plant thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy or rocky soils. Its flowering period typically occurs in late summer to early fall, attracting various pollinators. Piptocarpha steyermarkii plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity in its native habitat.
